CustomField.title: Custom Field
CustomField.popUpMessage: Specify what values are allowed for this property. These rules apply when creating, editing, and updating records.

updateCustomFiled.message_1: When editing a custom field that impacts existing contacts, all previous records will be updated to align with the new configuration. For example, if you change a city name from 'Bombay' to 'Mumbai', all contacts whose city was previously 'Bombay' will be updated to 'Mumbai'.
updateCustomFiled.message_2: Updating this custom field will invalidate all existing dates in contacts, and new changes will apply to all future entries.

bulkUpdateLearner.title: Bulk Update Learner Data
bulkUpdateLearner.message: You can update leaner data in bulk by downloading the existing Leaner Data and modifying only the permitted fields, which include Tag, Job Role, and Group ID. We recommend uploading only the data that needs updating and deleting any unnecessary rows for optimal efficiency. Are you ready to proceed?
bulkUpdateLearner.messageContact: You can update contact data in bulk by downloading the existing Contact Data and modifying only the permitted fields, which include Tag, Job Role, and Group ID. We recommend uploading only the data that needs updating and deleting any unnecessary rows for optimal efficiency. Are you ready to proceed?

FormattingInstruction.title: Formatting Instruction
FormattingInstruction.info: Allow the parsing instruction to also format the output.

parsingInstruction.title: Parsing Instruction
parsingInstruction.placeholder: The provided document is a manga comic book. Most pages do NOT have a title. It does not contain tables. Try to reconstruct the dialogue spoken in a cohesive way.
parsingInstruction.info: Parsing instructions are a way to instruct the model for document parsing. They are applied on each page of the document.

takeScreenshot.title: Take Screenshot
takeScreenshot.info: Take a screenshot of each page and add it to JSON output

annotateLinks.title: Annotate Links
annotateLinks.info: Annotate links in markdown. LlamaParse will try to add links from document into the markdown.

skipDiagonalText.title: Skip Diagonal Text
skipDiagonalText.info: By default LlamaParse extracts all text from your document.

doNotUnrollColumns.title: Do Not Unroll Columns
doNotUnrollColumns.error: Do Not Unroll Columns is required.
doNotUnrollColumns.info: To help with document reconstruction, LlamaParse will unroll the columns of the document, i.e. parse multiple columns of text as a single continuous block. If the 'Do not unroll columns' option is selected, LlamaParse will not unroll the columns of the document, making the reading order harder to follow for Large Language Models.

targetPages.title: Target Pages
targetPages.info: A comma separated string listing the page to be extracted. By default, all pages will be extracted. Pages are numbered starting at 0.

boundingBox.title: Bounding Box
boundingBox.info: Specify an area of a document that you want to parse. This can be helpful to remove headers and footers. To do so you need to provide the bounding box margin in clockwise order from the top in a comma-separated. The margins are expressed as a fraction of the page size, a number between 0 and 1. Examples: To exclude the top 10% of a document: bounding_box='0.1,0,0,0' To exclude the top 10% and bottom 20% of a document: bounding_box='0.1,0,0.2,0'

pageSeparator.title: Page Separator
pageSeparator.info:
The string to use as page separator in text and markdown results. If not specified, the default is '
---
'. If the string contains the text {pageNumber} it will be replaced by the page number of the next page.

pagePrefix.title: Page Prefix
pagePrefix.info: A string to use as the page prefix, empty by default. If the string contains the text {pageNumber} it will be replaced by the page number.

pageSuffix.title: Page Suffix
pageSuffix.info: A string to use as the page suffix, empty by default. If the string contains the text {pageNumber} it will be replaced by the page number.

invalidateCache.title: Invalidate Cache
invalidateCache.info: LlamaParse keeps results cached for 48 hours after upload.

doNotCache.title: Do Not Cache
doNotCache.info: LlamaParse keeps results cached for 48 hours after upload.

Home.supportoptiontitle1: We are available to make your experience as smooth as possible. Whether you have questions, need assistance, or want to report an issue, we've got you covered. You can use our ticket management system to submit your concerns, or you can email us at
Home.supportoptiontitle2: We will do our best to get you back on track as soon as we can. We value your feedback and are committed to providing top-notch support.
Home.notickitopen: You have not opened any tickets.

Home.aboutustext: Note: You can edit this image and text for your users. This can be done from General Settings > Edit (for Account/Branch you want to edit) > App Branding.
Home.aboutustextforneosapdrip: Drip App is a no-nonsense microlearning app that delivers engaging learning content to everyday apps.
Home.aboutustextforneosapdiwo: Diwo digitizes classroom & virtual classroom training workflows, activities & materials to deliver a new age experience to your learners.
